org.typemeta.funcj.control

Interface Option<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the successful result type
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Option.None, Option.Some

    public interface Option<T>
    A type representing a value which may be either present or absent.

    A Option<T> value is either the sub-type Option.None<T> which indicates an absent value, or the sub-type Option.Some<T> which wraps a value of type T.

    Option is biased towards the Option.Some<T>, meaning that map, apply and flatMap operate on the Some value and bypass the None value.

    Null values are not allowed.

    • Nested Class Summary

      static class  Option.Some<T>

                                       Functions.F<T,Option<U>> f)
        Standard applicative traversal.

        Equivalent to 

        sequence(lt.map(f))
        .
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of list elements
        U - the type wrapped by the Option returned by the function
        Parameters:
        lt - the list of values
        f - the function to be applied to each value in the list
        Returns:
        a Option which wraps an IList of values

      • sequence

        static <T> Option<IList<T>> sequence(IList<Option<T>> ltt)
        Standard applicative sequencing.

        Translate a IList of Option into a Option of an IList, by composing each consecutive Option using the apply(Option) method.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the value type of the Options in the list
        Parameters:
        ltt - the list of Option values
        Returns:
        a Option which wraps an IList of values

      • tailRecM

        static <A,B> Option<B> tailRecM(A a,
                                Functions.F<A,Option<Either<A,B>>> f)
        Repeatedly call the function f until it returns Either.Right.

        Call the function f and if it returns a right value then return the wrapped value, otherwise extract the value and call f again.

        Type Parameters:
        A - the starting value type
        B - the final value type
        Parameters:
        a - the starting value
        f - the function
        Returns:
        the final value

        Indicates if this is a {code Some} value.
        Returns:
        true if this value is a {code Some} value

        Optional<T> asOptional()
        Downgrade this value into an Optional.
        Returns:

        Parameters:
        defaultValue - value to be returned if this is a failure value.
        Returns:
        the success result value if it's a Some, otherwise return the supplied default value.

      • map

        <U> Option<U> map(Functions.F<? super T,? extends U> f)
        Functor function application. If this value is a Some then apply the function to the value, otherwise if this is a None then leave it untouched.
        Type Parameters:
        U - the function return type
        Parameters:
        f - the function to be applied
        Returns:
        a Option that wraps the function result, or the original none

      • apply

        <U> Option<U> apply(Option<Functions.F<T,U>> tf)
        Applicative function application (inverted). If the tf parameter is a Some value and this is a Some value, then apply the function wrapped in the tf to this.
        Type Parameters:
        U - the return type of function
        Parameters:
        tf - the function wrapped in a Option
        Returns:
        a Option wrapping the result of applying the function, or a None value

      • flatMap

        <U> Option<U> flatMap(Functions.F<? super T,Option<U>> f)
        Monadic bind/flatMap. If this is a Some then apply the function to the value and return the result, otherwise return the None result.
        Type Parameters:
        U - the type parameter to the Option returned by the function
        Parameters:
        f - the function to be applied
        Returns:
        the result of combining this value with the function f
